snippet: A Grinnell College player scored a record 138 points in a rout over Faith Baptist Bible, and with his accomplishment came thoughts on ethical behavior in such games.
abstract: Samuel G Freedman On Religion column examines punishing basketball defeat delivered by Grinnell college to Faith Baptist and moral and theological questions that it raises; many have lauded performance of Grinnell's star player Jack Taylor, who scored NCAA record of 138 points, others have compared extent of defeat to sin of gluttony; both teams have been left to interpret their roles through Biblical lens.
lead_paragraph: A Grinnell College player scored a record 138 points in a rout over Faith Baptist Bible, and with his accomplishment came thoughts on ethical behavior in such games.

headline.print_headline: A Basketball Blowout and Its Celebration Raise Theological Questions
headline.seo: A Basketball Blowout Raises Theological Questions
headline.main: A Basketball Blowout and Its Celebration Raise Theological Questions

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Faith Baptist Bible College and Theological Seminary (Ankeny, Iowa)
